title: Senegalia montis-salinarum
text:
Senegalia montis-salinarum, is a species of thorn tree that is native to two separate localities in the <a href="Soutpansberg">Soutpansberg</a> range in <a href="Limpopo">Limpopo</a>, South Africa. The total population is estimated at no more than 250 adult trees. Based on its morphology, it is assigned to the "<a href="Senegalia%20burkei">S. burkei</a>" <a href="species%20complex">species complex</a>.
Habitat.
It grows on rocky scree slopes in the hot <a href="rain%20shadow">rain shadow</a> of the Soutpansberg range.
Description.
It is a multi-stemmed tree. It has smaller flowers than "A. burkei" and produces more seeds. The wood is soft and semi-succulent, and dead wood decays quickly.
Status.
It may qualify as <a href="Endangered%20species">endangered</a> due to the small population size and the proximity of the type locality to Coal of Africa's Makhado Colliery project.
